comments.post_title: Nissan surges on report Japan group may seek Tesla investment
comments.comment_body: Of course! And some American (high-end working truck) vehicles have reliable engines and undercarriages but they are expensive. Even among those markets there are missers (looking at Dodge and Chrysler: hate-love relationship with me AND each other). I am glad American cars are not that common in Europe; instead we have overcomplicated German reliance or Southern European emotions packed into our hoods. To not even speak of what the Brits produced. Everything truly was better before 2000 from a mechanical reliance point of view it seems.
